description: From Middle English wyndles, equivalent to wind +‎ -less. Cognate with Old Norse vindlauss (“windless”).

adjectives.description: windless (comparative more windless, superlative most windless)

examples: The next work is racking or tentering the cloth  […]  and this is performed by setting it in a frame, which we call tenters, such as are to be seen in many fields about London, wherein (it having a windless at one end) it is first strained to its length, then afterwards to its breadth and parallelism  […]
